video.title: Android Development for Beginners - Full Course
video.description:
Learn how to develop an android app from scratch in this full course for beginners. No prior programming experience required!
Here is the 2nd part of this course (also free!): https://youtu.be/RcSHAkpwXAQ

In this course, you will learn how to build a real-word Android application from scratch using Java. On the way to building an Android app, you will learn the basics of programming in Java and object-oriented programming.

✏️ Course from MeiCode. Check out his YouTube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCE3wAhsfp4wGRgHXIQjVx0w

Extended 55-hour course: https://courses.meicode.org/courses/android2020

⭐️ Course Contents ⭐️
⌨️ (0:00) Course Introduction
⌨️ (3:12) Setup The Environment
⌨️ (18:52) Create Your First Application (Part 1)
⌨️ (43:53) Create Your First Application (Part 2)
⌨️ (59:20) Challenge
⌨️ (1:07:19) Variables and Arithmetic Operators
⌨️ (1:31:12) Relational and Logical Operators) Conditional Statements
⌨️ (1:47:43) Loops
⌨️ (2:04:13) Challenge (Create a Game)
⌨️ (2:16:00) Simple Arrays
⌨️ (2:27:51) Object Oriented Programming (Part 1)
⌨️ (2:49:30) Object Oriented Programming (Part 2)
⌨️ (3:06:02) Object Oriented Programming (Part 3)
⌨️ (3:19:41) OOP Challenge
⌨️ (3:43:56) Collections in Java
⌨️ (4:06:14) Static Keyword - Inner Classes
⌨️ (4:17:04) Interfaces and Abstract Classes
⌨️ (4:35:26) Concurrency - Exceptions
⌨️ (4:46:05) Singleton Pattern
⌨️ (4:56:00) Challenge (Part 1)
⌨️ (5:18:16) Challenge (Part 2)
⌨️ (5:39:40) User Interface Basics (Part 1)
⌨️ (6:04:21) User Interface Basics (Part 2)
⌨️ (6:33:09) User Interface Basics (Part 3)
⌨️ (6:58:39) Layouts
⌨️ (7:26:53) Images
⌨️ (7:37:32) ListView and Spinner
⌨️ (8:00:57) Different XML Files (Part 1)
⌨️ (8:29:41) Different XML Files (Part 2)
⌨️ (8:41:09) Material Design
⌨️ (8:59:58) Snackbar and CardView
⌨️ (9:16:51) RecyclerView (Part 1)

topLevelComment.author: Anastasiia Protsykevych
topLevelComment.text:
Thanks, this is a great guide on mobile app development; I like it👍👍
I just want to add some words about innovative mobile app features every developer (junior, middle or senior) should now. There are:
1.Voice-driven Interfaces
Voice recognition technologies allow users to interact with the product without hands and eyes, focusing their attention elsewhere. Such technologies have already come a long way but are still far from perfect.
2. Predictive Behavior Modeling
Here are some examples of prediction behavior modeling: Dynamic Difficulty Adjustment (DDA) in mobile games, which can adapt a game to make it easier or harder based on a player’s state (such as boredom or frustration), or an online store that sends emails with groups of goods that a person is just going to buy.
3. Smart Data Transfer
In just a second, you can transfer images, videos, contacts, or even money with simple movements of the phone, using a compass, GPS, or hydraulic sensor.
If you want to learn more about innovative mobile app features, such as Converged Application Platform (CAP) or Native Advertising, I recommend you read this article: https://jetsoftpro.com/5-features-of-mobile-applications-which-will-change-the-market-jetsoftpro/

topLevelComment.author: Ronald Maffei de Lavor
topLevelComment.text:
Os Mistérios Luminosos
Meditados às quintas-feiras 
 
Este novo ciclo de mistérios, estabelecido por João  Paulo II em sua Carta Apostólica  “O Rosário da Virgem Maria”, nos leva a contemplar o mistério do Cristo que é luz.  Esta dimensão é percebida principalmente na vida pública de Jesus. O Evangelho de São Marcos começa no deserto, daí seu símbolo ser o leão. Desde sua primeira viagem, tornou-se companheiro do apóstolo Paulo. Marcos viveu em Roma por volta do ano 70, onde foi secretário e confidente de Pedro.  Portanto, seu Evangelho nos transmite a catequese do chefe dos Apóstolos. Trata-se do mais curto dos Evangelhos, em estilo simples, vivo e pitoresco, rico em detalhes concretos.  Certamente Pedro conservara, de sua profissão de pescador, a aptidão de observar! João Paulo II escolheu cinco momentos da vida de Cristo. O Batismo, no rio Jordão, nos permite ouvir a voz do Pai que proclama Jesus seu Filho Bem Amado.  Em Caná, com seu primeiro milagre, Cristo abre o coração dos Apóstolos  ao mesmo tempo para a fé e para a intercessão de Maria. Quando Jesus anuncia a aproximação do Reino de Deus, é um chamado à conversão e assim inicia seu ministério da misericórdia. Na Transfiguração, Cristo resplandece na glória de sua divindade e o Pai lhe dá a conhecer aos Apóstolos para que eles o sigam. Na Eucaristia, Cristo se transforma, sob as espécies de pão e vinho, em seu Corpo e seu Sangue para nosso alimento.

topLevelComment.author: Aarya Deshpande
topLevelComment.text:
56:21 Question: Notice how, in line 17, the object is named "edtTxtName" (in grey) and id we gave it was "edtTxtName" (in purple). So both are titled the same.

1. Should we follow that convention where the object name (grey) and id name (purple) are titled the same? Because in line 22, that isn't the case (object name is "txtHello" and id name is "txtMessage").

2. Secondly, what really is the difference between the object name (grey) and id names (purple) in terms of their role/purpose? Thanks!

replies.author: Aarya Deshpande
replies.text: @nomad sitter Thanks for the descriptive answer! That really helped!

replies.author: nomad sitter
replies.text:
1. I think that's a preference. I have found that it is helpful if they are named the same because then you just know what view you are refering to. But again, totally not necessary for any code to work.
2. The difference is that the name (grey) in your java file is the name you give to an object (in this case an object View. In the XML file you are giving your view (in this case the Edit Text) a name (purple), an id, to refer to it in your code. For example, think about it as if you were saving your friend's contact info on your phone. Your friend has a legal name (alex), and you can either save it on your phone like that or just use a petname like "bestie" or "favorite". In order to be able to call your friend easily, you will need to have their contact information saved on your phone, and it probably will help if you use their real name (alex), so then you don't get confused and don't remember what friend is it. But, regardless how you save it (alex or "bestie") it will work anyways as long as you save the right phone number correctly when creating the contact (  using findViewById((R.id.alex) in your java file Android, when creating the object View (with the name in grey). Now, separately from that, the use of giving a View an id is because you might want the view to do something. Going back to the same "friend metaphor", if you never need to call your friend, then you don't need to create their contact on your phone at all. Same with views! Some views won't need an id (the name in purple) if you don't need to do anything with them in your code. But if you need to do something with them such as make them trigger something to happen when clicked or collecting text from them, then they will need an id (name in purple). Hope this helps!

replies.author: Sean Ward
replies.text: That depends for app development C#, C++, Java are good to have for desktop apps. For IOS devices they use Swift and for Andriod, they use Kotin or Java. However, if you're an absolute beginner I suggest you start with a language like Python which is used for data analysis, AI, some app/web development, and more its full-stack ore on the backend side of development and is great to know for anyone. Another good beginning combo is HTML and CSS they are used for web development and are very simple languages that expand into others like Javascript which is used for backend web development but you can also make some games and apps with it. It's really up to you on where to start but that's what I got if have more questions feel free to ask :).

replies.text:

in AndroidManifest.xml replace 
<activity android:name=".MainActivity">
with 
<activity android:name=".MainActivity"
            android:exported="true"> 
This will fix the second error.

topLevelComment.author: Bud
topLevelComment.text:
9:24 => atom_64 system image (for working than one Google API like Youtube, Google map)
28:38 => res folder for the static variables
28:52 => manifest folder is specified some general properties like icon, name, and some other properties and features of the app
29:43, 30:04, 30:11 => Gradle will combine files and create an APK file (if you want to test the app on an emulator/ to release the app/to use other people's code)
31:30 => //TODO:
32:05 => terminal is useful to work extensively with SQL lite database
33:06, 33:17, 33:43 => rebuild if you get some warnings, close the project, or invalidate caches/restart
34:08, 36:17 => android profiler to see how much resources the app is using
 37:49 => turn off the blueprint
38:04 => adding button
39:22 => design and text view
40:44 => id
42:24, 42:28, 42:55 - 43:13 => constrain or chain to somewhere because if it's not constrained it'll be floating (the exact location is unknown)

46:03, 46:17 => onCreate &  setContentView
47:56, 48:07 => TextView, findViewById(R.id.xyz)
50:30 => setText

51:18 => onClick="name"
52:41, 52:48 => create a method
53:47, 54:20, 54:45, 55:06 => plain text, changing the constrain, adding margin, the difference of hint and text
56:18, 58:00, 58:59 => define the EditText, get text to string, hello + name

59:55, 1:02:50, 1:04:25 - 1:07:12 => practice 1, anchor, code

# Java
1:08:57 - 1:11:02 => using IntelliJ IDEA coz Android Studio won't support plain Java (set up)
1:12:30 => psvm (public static void main), sout (system out println);

topLevelComment.author: Alphasok Takubetz
topLevelComment.text:
Today, we are kicking off Pi’s first Hackathon as the first event for our developer community. The #BuildPi2gether Hackathon is a collaborative event where Pioneers & developers join to build the future of Pi together. The event will span 7 weeks from June 28-August 10th.

In total, up to US$50,000 and 50,000 Pi in prizes per category, which makes $100,000 USD and 100,000 Pi for both categories.

1st prize = US$20,000 + 20,000 Pi

2nd prize = US$15,000 + 15,000 Pi

3rd prize = US$10,000 + 10,000 Pi

Honorary mentions (5 winners) = US$1000 each + 1,000 Pi

Judges and the Pioneer community will evaluate projects. Winners will be decided by the Pi Core Team based on these ratings.

Winning Pi Hackathon teams have full responsibility on how they will handle their treasury & prize distribution. They will need to designate one account to receive the prize.

To participate in the online hackathon:

Join the Hackathon on the Brainstorm app.

Propose an idea or join an existing team.

Join your Hackathon team’s dedicated Discord channel after receiving an invitation to the new developer Discord server.

Build your idea with your team until August 10th. Remember certain deadlines — detailed below — such as when to submit a mid-term progress report and final video presentation!

A well-balanced Hackathon team will compromise of experts in:

Development: Builders of the third-party Pi app with code

Business: Professionals determining the business viability and growth of the project

Marketing and Communications: Specialists presenting their product vision to the community

Design: Artists creating the UI/UX of the app for Pioneers’ usability

Others: Pi Hackathon is open to everyone! Communicate and utilize your special skill sets to contribute to the future of Pi. Reach out to teams and share your expertise.

Everyone is invited to participate for free just by downloading the Pi app on their mobile phone.
How Do I Earn (Mine) Pi Currency For Free?
Step 1: Get to Download the Pi Network app in Google Play Store
Step 2: Sign up with your Facebook account or mobile number.
Step 3: Set up your password.
Step 4: Set up your account by filling in the proper details.
Step 5: Enter the invitation code “kochok”
Step 6: Sign up completed. Following then tap the lightning icon on the right to start mining

topLevelComment.author: PlanYourLift
topLevelComment.text: If there are any true beginners out there (like me). I committed to this video until the two hour mark before finding that it wasn't quite beginners level. I have since been learning via a resource called "MOCC" https://java-programming.mooc.fi/.It's free and has been going through Javascript in baby steps and with heaps of exercises along the way to have you entering code all the way along. That way you're not just a passive listener to a lecture or just following along someone else doing code and virtually copying that. I think maybe after I finish the first and second Javascript modules within MOOC this freecodecamp video might be more useful (as a refresher or what have you). But it's not the best for a learner like me that learns by doing.

replies.author: Guillermo González
replies.text: @Akshat Gupta I suggest you create a new profile in Windows 10, check the specific AMD Video drivers, install Intellij community (which is almost the same as Android Studio) and Oracle JDK to see how it behaves, ah and in Android Studio in AVM install Android Emulator Hypervisor driver for AMD. Another option you have to do tests is to install any Linux distro and test these same programs so that you can check their behavior, then you can define if it is a problem with Windows, or the specifications of your laptop.

topLevelComment.author: Kevin Huang
topLevelComment.text: At 39:15, design view and text view is mentioned for the xml file. For anyone using Android Studio 4.0, the buttons to switch view have moved to the top right of the window above the attributes panel. The button for text view is now called "Code", then you have a button that says "Split" which simultaneously displays the code view and design view side by side; and lastly you have the button that says "Design", which is the design view.

replies.author: Ronald Maffei de Lavor
replies.text:
Oração à Virgem Maria pela Santa Pureza

“Santa Pureza, a rainha das virtudes, a virtude angélica, é uma jóia tão preciosa que aquele que a possui se torna como os anjos de Deus no Céu, ainda que revestidos da mortalidade da carne.” São João Bosco.

Fazemos parte de uma realidade cujo desprezo pela virtude da pureza está cada vez mais ascendente. Assim, nossa vigilância, a fim de que não caiamos na mesmice oferecida pelo pecado, deve ser revestida pela fortaleza advinda da oração. Busquemos, principalmente, espelharmo-nos na vida e nas virtudes e plenitude de dons de Maria Puríssima, “criatura mais preciosa da criação” (São Cirilo de Alexandria), que é nossa mediadora ao Mestre Jesus, verdadeiro Deus e verdadeiro Homem, puro por excelência e digno de adoração.

Rezemos a seguinte Oração a Maria Santíssima pela Santa Pureza:
 
1. Coração Puríssimo de Maria, por vosso amor e com vosso auxílio, estou resolvido a não consentir, neste dia, em nenhum pensamento impuro. Ajudai-me, Senhora, a afastá-los logo. 

Ave Maria, cheia de graça, 
o Senhor é convosco, 
bendita sois vós entre as mulheres 
e bendito é o fruto do vosso ventre, Jesus. 
Santa Maria, Mãe de Deus, 
rogai por nós pecadores, 
agora e na hora da nossa morte. Amém.

Ave Maria, gratia plena, Dóminus tecum.
Benedícta tu in muliéribus,
et benedíctus fructus ventris tui, Iesus.
Sancta Maria, Mater Dei,
ora pro nobis peccatóribus,
nunc, et in hora mortis nostræ.
Amen.

2. Coração Puríssimo de Maria por vosso amor e com vosso auxílio, estou resolvido a não proferir, neste dia, palavra alguma indecente. Purificai, Senhora, a minha língua. 

Ave Maria...                                                                         

3. Coração Puríssimo de Maria por vosso amor e com vosso auxílio, estou resolvido a guardar, neste dia, especial modéstia em todas as minhas ações. Ó Senhora minha! Ó minha Mãe! Impetrai-me a graça de sempre e em tudo dar gosto ao vosso Puríssimo Coração. 

Ave Maria...

Meu Jesus,

Fazei-me puro. Puro nos olhos, pensamentos e nas ações.
Fazei-me humilde, que eu sempre desconfie de mim mesmo e não me exponha ao perigo do pecado.
Fazei-me penitente, dai-me amor ao sofrimento; tanto sofrestes por mim, que quero sofrer por vós.
Fazei-me generoso, para que eu nada vos recuse e toda a minha vida seja vossa.
Fazei-me zeloso pela Glória de Deus e pela Salvação das almas.
Meu Jesus, fazei-me obediente aos meus pais e superiores.

Amém!

 Uma alma pura é uma pérola preciosa. Enquanto está escondida na concha no fundo do mar, ninguém pensa em admirá-la. Mas se a trouxermos para a luz, esta pérola brilhará e atrairá todos os olhares. Portanto, a alma pura que está escondida aos olhos do mundo um dia irá brilhar ante os anjos no sol da eternidade. São João Maria Vianney

Deus Vos salve Virgem da Trindade templo, alegria dos anjos, da pureza exemplo!
 (Trecho do Ofício da Imaculada Conceição)

http://www.catolicoarretado.com.br/2017/06/oracao-virgem-maria-pela-santa-pureza.html?m=1#:~:text=Meu%20Jesus%2C,que%20quero%20sofrer%20por%20v%C3%B3s.
